alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 03 at 10:38AM CST until March 04 at 2:20PM CST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... St. Francis River near Patterson affecting Wayne County. .St. Francis River Remains above flood stage. For the St. Francis River...including Patterson, Fisk...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...St. Francis River near Patterson. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early tomorrow afternoon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 18.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1245 PM CST.
